Instruction: Rehydrate the Seaweed: In a large bowl, combine the dried wakame seaweed with the cold water. Let it soak for 10-15 minutes, or until the seaweed rehydrates and becomes tender and pliable.
Drain and Rinse: Once rehydrated, drain the seaweed in a colander and rinse it thoroughly under cold running water to remove any excess salt or debris.
Prepare the Dressing: In a separate bowl, whisk together the rice vinegar, soy sauce, toasted sesame oil, sugar, grated ginger, and minced garlic (optional).
Combine and Season: Add the drained and rinsed seaweed, sliced scallions, and sliced cucumber to the bowl with the dressing. Toss gently to coat all the ingredients evenly.
Taste and Adjust: Taste the salad and adjust the seasoning with additional rice vinegar, soy sauce, or sesame oil to your preference.
Serve and Enjoy: Transfer the salad to a serving dish and garnish with toasted sesame seeds. Serve cold as a refreshing side dish or appetizer.
For Extra Flavor (Optional):  Incorporate shredded carrots, chopped fresh cilantro, or a pinch of red pepper flakes for added flavor and texture.
Citrusy Variation (Optional):  For a brighter flavor, add a tablespoon of fresh lime juice to the dressing.
